text:
Foley Square, northward, from the Municipal Building, showing this civic center prior to improvement. Thru the center runs Centre Street (cartracks). On the left and right respectively are Lafayette and Park Streets. The solitary one story clinical (narcotic addictions) faces on Worth Street. Columbus Park is in the right background. This open area, the Collect Pond site, has not as yet been improved because of shifting sands. Engineering advances will enable this danger to be avoided. Incidentally this was the scene of the first work relief program in New York; the Pond being filled in by men that were thrown out of work by the embargo declared by President Jefferson in 1812. He, fearing naval complications with Great Britain closed the port.

Gift of E. M. Jenks

1916-7
title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Municipal building.

text:
Foley Square, northward, from the Municipal Building, showing this civic center prior to improvement. Thru the center runs Centre Street (cartracks). On the left and right respectively are Lafayette and Park Streets. The solitary one story clinical (narcotic addictions) faces on Worth Street. Columbus Park is in the right background.
This open area, the Collect Pond site, has not as yet been improved because of shifting sands. Engineering advances will enable this danger to be avoided. Incidentally this was the scene of the first work relief program in New York; the Pond being filled in by men that were thrown out of work by the embargo declared by President Jefferson in 1812. 1916-7

Gift of E. M. Jenks
title: Manhattan: Foley Square - 58th Street

text:
(1) Leonard Street, west from and including Baxter Street, showing (left), The Tombs Prison(fortress like building with tower), occupying the block from Centre to Lafayette Streets. Also shown is Baxter Street, west side, north from and including Leonard, to, but not including Franklin Streets. The south side of Leonard, from Baxter to Centre Streets, is an empty lot and is used for parking automobiles, and at the extreme right are visible trees from Columbus Park.

September 24, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A view at a later date, showing in addition the north side of the New York State Office Building on the south side of Leonard Street. West of same appears a portion of the new Department of Health, Hospitals and Sanitation Building. The factory buildings appearing on the right will be demolished and upon their site will rise a unit of the new Criminal Courts Building replacing the old structure and the Tombs.

November 6, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Leonard Street, west from and including Baxter Street, showing (left), The Tombs Prison(fortress like building with tower), occupying the block from Centre to Lafayette Streets. Also shown is Baxter Street, west side, north from and including Leonard, to, but not including Franklin Streets. The south side of Leonard, from Baxter to Centre Streets, is an empty lot and is used for parking automobiles, and at the extreme right are visible trees from Columbus Park.

September 24, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A view at a later date, showing in addition the north side of the New York State Office Building on the south side of Leonard Street. West of same appears a portion of the new Department of Health, Hospitals and Sanitation Building. The factory buildings appearing on the right will be demolished and upon their site will rise a unit of the new Criminal Courts Building replacing the old structure and the Tombs.

November 6, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
The excavation for the new Department of Health Building, bounded by Worth Street (in the foreground), north to and including Leonard Street, Lafayette Street, east to and including Centre Street. This view also shows the northern extremity of Foley Square.
March 26, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a close up of the excavation on the site of the new Department of Health Building.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, a close up of No. 1 from a slightly different angle.
March 26, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Franklin Street, west from Baxter Street and showing in the foreground, on both sides, the buildings that will be demolished to provide a site for the new Criminal Courts Building; replacing the bridged structures shown between Centre and Lafayette Streets. This is a set of three views; No. 2 of which shows only the south side of the block between Baxter and Centre Streets.

November 6, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

This is a set of three views; No. 2 of which shows only the south side of the block between Baxter and Centre Streets.
